title: People's Liberation Army Air Force donates anti-epidemic materials to the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) in November 2020
description: On November 21, 2020, the Chinese embassy in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) held a handover ceremony for a donation of anti-epidemic materials to the Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC). The materials were provided by the Chinese People's Liberation Army. Some of the materials included medical masks, forehead thermometers, and protective clothing. The purpose of the donation was to help the DRC further improve its prevention and control capabilities and respond to a new round of epidemic threats. The supplies were officially donated in June 2020 by the People's Liberation Army Air Force.   The handover ceremony was in Kinshasa and was attended by Chinese Ambassador to the DRC Zhu Jing, Congolese Defense Minister Ngoi, Deputy Chief of General Staff Lieutenant General Ndima, Defense Attache Colonel Ma Fei of the Chinese embassy, and Economic and Commercial Counselor Xu Yuanjie.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
People's Liberation Army Air Force donates anti-epidemic materials to the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) in November 2020

# Description
On November 21, 2020, the Chinese embassy in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) held a handover ceremony for a donation of anti-epidemic materials to the Armed Forces of the DRC (FARDC). The materials were provided by the Chinese People's Liberation Army. Some of the materials included medical masks, forehead thermometers, and protective clothing. The purpose of the donation was to help the DRC further improve its prevention and control capabilities and respond to a new round of epidemic threats. The supplies were officially donated in June 2020 by the People's Liberation Army Air Force.   The handover ceremony was in Kinshasa and was attended by Chinese Ambassador to the DRC Zhu Jing, Congolese Defense Minister Ngoi, Deputy Chief of General Staff Lieutenant General Ndima, Defense Attache Colonel Ma Fei of the Chinese embassy, and Economic and Commercial Counselor Xu Yuanjie.
justification: Project is a donation of medical supplies for epidemic prevention, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials including medical masks, forehead thermometers, and protective clothing

title: The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCCPC) donates anti-epidemic materials to Democratic Republic of the Congo Political Parties in November 2020
description: On November 11 and 12, 2020, the Chinese ambassador to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) Zhu Jing provided anti-epidemic materials to two leading political parties of the DRC: the Union for Democracy and Social Progress (UDPS) and the People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy (PPRD). The international department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCCPC) funded the donation.    The materials were donated in a handover ceremony attended by Kabuya, general secretary of the UDPS, and Ramazani, executive secretary of the PPRD. Both leaders expressed gratitude toward the CCCPC for their support and praised the Chinese Communist Party.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
On November 11 and 12, 2020, the Chinese ambassador to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) Zhu Jing provided anti-epidemic materials to two leading political parties of the DRC: the Union for Democracy and Social Progress (UDPS) and the People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy (PPRD). The international department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCCPC) funded the donation.    The materials were donated in a handover ceremony attended by Kabuya, general secretary of the UDPS, and Ramazani, executive secretary of the PPRD. Both leaders expressed gratitude toward the CCCPC for their support and praised the Chinese Communist Party.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Anti-epidemic materials donation, health sector focus, no energy-related components

title: Chinese government sends a team of 12 medical experts to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) for COVID-19 prevention in May 2020 (linked to project ID#94232)
description: On May 12, 2020, a team of 12 Chinese medical experts arrived in Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), and delivered anti-epidemic material assistance to the Congolese government (see project ID#94232 for the donation). The team consisted of experts in testing, respiratory medicine, traditional Chinese medicine, and infectious disease control. The team had three goals: instruct DRC doctors and leaders in Chinese methods and practices in prevention and control, donate supplies to the DRC, and exchange information with their Congolese counterparts to create avenues for future cooperation.
combined_text:

The team consisted of experts in testing, respiratory medicine, traditional Chinese medicine, and infectious disease control. The team had three goals: instruct DRC doctors and leaders in Chinese methods and practices in prevention and control, donate supplies to the DRC, and exchange information with their Congolese counterparts to create avenues for future cooperation.

title: China donates anti-epidemic supplies to the Democratic Republic of the Congo in May 2020 (linked to project ID#93002)
description: On May 12, 2020, a team of 12 Chinese medical experts arrived in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) to help fight the Covid-19 pandemic (see project ID#93002). The team also brought a donation of anti-pandemic supplies with them. Chinese Ambassador to the DRC, Zhu Jing, Deputy Mister of Foreign Affairs of the DRC, Chedia, Deputy Minister of Health, Albert Biyombo, and officials from various government offices, including the Ministry of International Cooperation of the DRC and the National Institute of Biomedical Research attended the handover ceremony.
combined_text:

The team also brought a donation of anti-pandemic supplies with them. Chinese Ambassador to the DRC, Zhu Jing, Deputy Mister of Foreign Affairs of the DRC, Chedia, Deputy Minister of Health, Albert Biyombo, and officials from various government offices, including the Ministry of International Cooperation of the DRC and the National Institute of Biomedical Research attended the handover ceremony.

title: China Eximbank restructures 2013 buyer’s credit loan for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project (Linked to Project ID#46183)
description: In 2013, China Eximbank and Djibouti's Ministry of Finance signed a $491,793,000 buyer's credit loan agreement for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project. This borrowing terms of the loan (captured via Project ID#46183) were as follows: an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 3% margin, a 15-year maturity, and a 5-year grace period. The borrower also purchased buyer’s credit insurance from China Export and Credit Insurance Corporation, which is widely known as Sinosure. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to partially finance a $550 million commercial (EPC) contract between the Government of Djibouti and China Rail Engineering Corporation (CREC) and China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC), which was signed on January 30, 2012. The Government of Djibouti covered the remaining $58 million of the commercial contract cost.   The purpose of the project was to construct a 100 km segment from Ali Sabieh to Nagad of the 756 km Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway from Addis Ababa, the capital of Ethiopia, to Doraleh port in Djibouti. CREC and CCECC were the contractors responsible for project implementation. Construction began on December 31, 2014 and the railway was opened for use on January 1, 2018. It remains to be seen if the Djibouti-Addis Ababa Railway will find a path to commercial viability. Sinosure reportedly had to step in and write off approximately $1 billion in losses due to the poor commercial performance of the railway.   On December 31, 2017, the Government of Djibouti formally requested a restructuring of its loan with China Eximbank for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project. According to an email correspondence between the Executive Director of AidData and an IMF Mission Chief to Djibouti, in 2019, the Djiboutian authorities conducted discussions with China Eximbank to restructure a 2013 loan for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project (captured via Project ID#46183). The Djiboutian authorities reported to the IMF that a memorandum of understanding (MOU) had been signed in 2019 to extend the grace period from 5 years to 10 years, extend maturity of the loan from 15 years to 25 years, and to reduce the interest rate from 3.409% (0.409% [2013 avg. 6-month LIBOR] + 3% [300 basis points]) to 2.509% (0.409% [2013 avg. 6-month LIBOR] + 2.1% [210 basis points]). The Djiboutian authorities also indicated that arrears on interest payments on this loan that had been accumulated during the restructuring discussion (worth 1.2 percent of the country’s GDP) had been restructured—and that they were integrated to the principal and expected to be repaid over the extended amortization period.   The new terms of the loan reportedly reduced the present value of the country’s debt-to-GDP ratio by 4 percentage points and smoothed total debt service. However, the final loan restructuring agreement (captured via Project ID#85163) was not signed until September 2, 2020. It not only codified the terms and conditions that were first specified in the 2019 MOU, but also sought to improve the performance and profitability of the railway in order to increase revenue generation. The restructuring agreement was ratified into Djiboutian law in February 2021.
staff_comments: 1. On July 15, 2019, Ilyas Moussa Dawaleh, Minister of Economy and Finance of Djibouti, tweeted that a restructuring of the China Eximbank loan for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project would soon be finalized after ‘a few small details’ were settled. He then met with China Eximbank in Beijing to iron out these details on August 7, 2019. A picture of the meeting shows three Djiboutian government representatives and 10 China Eximbank representatives.
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
China Eximbank restructures 2013 buyer’s credit loan for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project (Linked to Project ID#46183)

# Description
In 2013, China Eximbank and Djibouti's Ministry of Finance signed a $491,793,000 buyer's credit loan agreement for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project. This borrowing terms of the loan (captured via Project ID#46183) were as follows: an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 3% margin, a 15-year maturity, and a 5-year grace period. The borrower also purchased buyer’s credit insurance from China Export and Credit Insurance Corporation, which is widely known as Sinosure. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to partially finance a $550 million commercial (EPC) contract between the Government of Djibouti and China Rail Engineering Corporation (CREC) and China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC), which was signed on January 30, 2012. The Government of Djibouti covered the remaining $58 million of the commercial contract cost.   The purpose of the project was to construct a 100 km segment from Ali Sabieh to Nagad of the 756 km Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway from Addis Ababa, the capital of Ethiopia, to Doraleh port in Djibouti. CREC and CCECC were the contractors responsible for project implementation. Construction began on December 31, 2014 and the railway was opened for use on January 1, 2018. It remains to be seen if the Djibouti-Addis Ababa Railway will find a path to commercial viability. Sinosure reportedly had to step in and write off approximately $1 billion in losses due to the poor commercial performance of the railway.   On December 31, 2017, the Government of Djibouti formally requested a restructuring of its loan with China Eximbank for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project. According to an email correspondence between the Executive Director of AidData and an IMF Mission Chief to Djibouti, in 2019, the Djiboutian authorities conducted discussions with China Eximbank to restructure a 2013 loan for the 100 km Ali Sabieh to Nagad Section of the Addis Ababa–Djibouti Railway Project (captured via Project ID#46183). The Djiboutian authorities reported to the IMF that a memorandum of understanding (MOU) had been signed in 2019 to extend the grace period from 5 years to 10 years, extend maturity of the loan from 15 years to 25 years, and to reduce the interest rate from 3.409% (0.409% [2013 avg. 6-month LIBOR] + 3% [300 basis points]) to 2.509% (0.409% [2013 avg. 6-month LIBOR] + 2.1% [210 basis points]). The Djiboutian authorities also indicated that arrears on interest payments on this loan that had been accumulated during the restructuring discussion (worth 1.2 percent of the country’s GDP) had been restructured—and that they were integrated to the principal and expected to be repaid over the extended amortization period.   The new terms of the loan reportedly reduced the present value of the country’s debt-to-GDP ratio by 4 percentage points and smoothed total debt service. However, the final loan restructuring agreement (captured via Project ID#85163) was not signed until September 2, 2020. It not only codified the terms and conditions that were first specified in the 2019 MOU, but also sought to improve the performance and profitability of the railway in order to increase revenue generation. The restructuring agreement was ratified into Djiboutian law in February 2021.
justification: Project involves railway construction and loan restructuring, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 100 km railway segment construction, loan restructuring terms, no mention of energy or environmental components

title: China sends epidemic expert team to Djibouti in April 2020
description: On April 30, 2020, the Chinese government sent an epidemic expert team to Djibouti to provide COVID-19 response and prevention assistance. This epidemic expert team consisted of 12 members. The National Health Commission formed the team and members were personally selected by the Sichuan Provincial and Tianjin Municipal Health Commissions. The team arrived at Djibouti’s Ambouli International Airport on April 30, 2020. Zhuo Ruisheng, China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, the representative of the Djibouti government, the Secretary of State for Youth and Sports, the Secretary-General of the Ministry of Health, the General Counsel of the Ministry of Health, and the relevant leaders of the National Anti-Epidemic Emergency Leadership Committee received the team at the airport.  On May 3, 2020, Prime Minister Kamil of Djibouti met with the epidemic expert team at the People's Palace in Djibouti. Zhuo Ruisheng, the Ambassador to Djibouti, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Djibouti, the Minister of Health, and the Presidential Health Advisor attended the meeting.   On May 10, 2020, Prime Minister Kamil of Djibouti awarded the Independence Day National Medal to all 12 members of the epidemic expert team at the Djibouti People's Palace. This medal was awarded in recognition of the expert team's contribution to Djibouti's fight against the epidemic. Djibouti’s Foreign Minister, the Minister of Health, and China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, attended the ceremony.  The expert team departed Djibouti and returned to China on May 11, 2020. Djibouti Foreign Minister Yusuf and the Minister of Health held a ceremony at the airport to see the expert group off on behalf of the Djibouti government. Zhuo Ruisheng, China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, was also present at the send-off.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends epidemic expert team to Djibouti in April 2020

# Description
On April 30, 2020, the Chinese government sent an epidemic expert team to Djibouti to provide COVID-19 response and prevention assistance. This epidemic expert team consisted of 12 members. The National Health Commission formed the team and members were personally selected by the Sichuan Provincial and Tianjin Municipal Health Commissions. The team arrived at Djibouti’s Ambouli International Airport on April 30, 2020. Zhuo Ruisheng, China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, the representative of the Djibouti government, the Secretary of State for Youth and Sports, the Secretary-General of the Ministry of Health, the General Counsel of the Ministry of Health, and the relevant leaders of the National Anti-Epidemic Emergency Leadership Committee received the team at the airport.  On May 3, 2020, Prime Minister Kamil of Djibouti met with the epidemic expert team at the People's Palace in Djibouti. Zhuo Ruisheng, the Ambassador to Djibouti, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Djibouti, the Minister of Health, and the Presidential Health Advisor attended the meeting.   On May 10, 2020, Prime Minister Kamil of Djibouti awarded the Independence Day National Medal to all 12 members of the epidemic expert team at the Djibouti People's Palace. This medal was awarded in recognition of the expert team's contribution to Djibouti's fight against the epidemic. Djibouti’s Foreign Minister, the Minister of Health, and China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, Zhuo Ruisheng, attended the ceremony.  The expert team departed Djibouti and returned to China on May 11, 2020. Djibouti Foreign Minister Yusuf and the Minister of Health held a ceremony at the airport to see the expert group off on behalf of the Djibouti government. Zhuo Ruisheng, China’s Ambassador to Djibouti, was also present at the send-off.
justification: Project is focused on public health assistance and epidemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Epidemic expert team providing COVID-19 response and prevention assistance, recognized for contribution to public health

title: International Liaison Department of the Communist Party of China donates anti-epidemic materials to Djibouti's People's League in September 2020
description: On September 7, 2020, the International Liaison Department of the Communist Party of China donated anti-epidemic materials to the People's League for Progress of Djibouti. The materials included medical masks and protective clothing. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Jianmeng headquarters. Zhuo Ruisheng, the Chinese Ambassador to Djibouti, the National Secretary of the People's League, and the Minister of Social Affairs and Solidarity attended the ceremony. The National Secretaries of the Human League were also in attendance.
combined_text:
# Sector

Zhuo Ruisheng, the Chinese Ambassador to Djibouti, the National Secretary of the People's League, and the Minister of Social Affairs and Solidarity attended the ceremony. The National Secretaries of the Human League were also in attendance.

evidence: Anti-epidemic materials (medical masks and protective clothing), health sector focus
